name: riboseq-profiling-qc
title: Translation Landscape Analysis
description: Comprehensive ribosome profiling pipeline for analyzing actively translated mRNAs using Ribo-seq data. Uncover ribosome occupancy, translation efficiency, upstream ORFs, and translational regulation across the transcriptome with quality control and quantification. Samplesheet format: `sample,fastq_1,fastq_2,strandedness,type`
content:
🧬 Ribosome Profiling (Ribo-seq): Translation Landscape Analysis

Measure Active Translation at Single-Codon Resolution

Ribosome profiling (Ribo-seq, also called ribosome footprinting) captures the exact positions of translating ribosomes across the transcriptome, revealing which mRNAs are actively being translated into proteins. Unlike RNA-seq which measures mRNA abundance, Ribo-seq directly measures translation - the critical step from gene to protein.

🎯 What is Ribosome Profiling?

Ribosome profiling is a powerful technique that:

  • 🔬 Captures ribosome-protected fragments: mRNA sequences protected by translating ribosomes (~28-30 nucleotides)

  • 📍 Provides codon-level resolution: Reveals exact position of ribosomes on mRNAs

  • ⚡ Measures translation efficiency: Ratio of ribosome occupancy to mRNA abundance

  • 🧬 Discovers regulatory features: Upstream ORFs (uORFs), alternative start codons, frameshifts

  • 🎯 Quantifies protein synthesis: Direct measurement of translation events

🔬 Key Applications

Translation Regulation Studies

  • 📊 Translation efficiency: Which mRNAs are heavily translated vs. just abundant?

  • 🧬 Upstream ORFs (uORFs): Regulatory elements in 5' UTRs that control translation

  • 🎯 Start codon usage: Alternative translation initiation sites (AUG, CUG, UUG)

  • ⚡ Ribosome pausing: Sites where ribosomes stall during elongation

Disease and Drug Research

  • 💊 Drug mechanism studies: Effects of translation inhibitors and therapeutics

  • 🦠 Viral translation: How viruses hijack host translation machinery

  • 🩺 Cancer biology: Oncogene translation and therapeutic targets

  • 🧠 Neurodegenerative diseases: Translation dysregulation in brain disorders

Fundamental Biology

  • 🌱 Development: Translational control during differentiation and embryogenesis

  • ⏰ Circadian rhythms: Time-dependent translation regulation

  • 🔋 Stress responses: Translation reprogramming under cellular stress

  • 🧫 Protein homeostasis: Quality control and degradation pathways

⚙️ Pipeline Features

Preprocessing and Quality Control

  • ✂️ rRNA depletion: Remove ribosomal RNA contamination (SortMeRNA)

  • 📏 Size selection: Filter for ribosome-protected fragments (28-30nt)

  • 🎯 Adapter trimming: Remove sequencing adapters (Trim Galore/fastp)

  • 📊 Quality metrics: FastQC reports for data quality assessment

Alignment and Quantification

  • 🗺️ Multiple aligners supported:

    • STAR - Splice-aware alignment (default, recommended)

    • Bowtie2 - Fast unspliced alignment option

    • HISAT2 - Memory-efficient splice-aware alignment

  • 🧮 Read counting: Gene-level and transcript-level quantification

  • 📍 P-site offset correction: Adjust read positions to ribosome P-site

Advanced Analysis Tools

  • 🔬 Ribo-TISH: Identify translation initiation sites, discover uORFs

    • Detect alternative translation start sites

    • Annotate novel upstream open reading frames

    • Characterize non-canonical translation events

  • 📊 Riboricer: Comprehensive Ribo-seq QC and analysis

    • Metagene analysis and ribosome occupancy profiles

    • Periodicity assessment (3-nucleotide codon phasing)

    • Translation efficiency calculations

📋 Sample Sheet Format

Your CSV samplesheet defines Ribo-seq experiments with optional RNA-seq controls:

sample,fastq_1,fastq_2,strandedness,type
Ribo_WT_R1,WT_Ribo_R1.fastq.gz,,forward,riboseq
Ribo_WT_R2,WT_Ribo_R2.fastq.gz,,forward,riboseq
RNA_WT_R1,WT_RNA_R1.fastq.gz,WT_RNA_R2.fastq.gz,forward,rnaseq
RNA_WT_R2,WT_RNA_R2_R1.fastq.gz,WT_RNA_R2_R2.fastq.gz,forward,rnaseq

Column Descriptions:

  • sample: Unique sample identifier

  • fastq_1: Read 1 file (Ribo-seq typically single-end)

  • fastq_2: Read 2 file (empty for single-end; used for paired-end RNA-seq)

  • strandedness: Library strandedness (forward, reverse, or unstranded)

  • type: Data type - riboseq (ribosome profiling), rnaseq (RNA-seq control), or tiseq (TI-seq)

🧬 Protocol Selection

Choose your experimental protocol for proper analysis:

  • standard: Standard ribosome profiling protocol (default)

  • ingolia: Original Ingolia et al. protocol

  • custom: Define custom preprocessing parameters

🧬 Reference Genome Selection

Choose from comprehensive genome collection:

  • 🧑 Human: GRCh38/hg38 (latest) or GRCh37/hg19 (legacy) - human translation studies

  • 🐭 Mouse: GRCm39/mm39 (latest) or GRCm38/mm10 - model organism research

  • 🔬 Model organisms: Zebrafish, fly (D. melanogaster), C. elegans, yeast (S. cerevisiae)

  • 🌱 Plants: Arabidopsis (TAIR10), rice, maize - plant translation research

📊 Comprehensive Results

Quantification Data

  • 📊 Gene counts: Read counts per gene from ribosome-protected fragments

  • 🧮 Translation efficiency: Ribo-seq/RNA-seq ratios for each gene

  • 📍 Codon occupancy: Ribosome density at codon resolution

  • 🎯 TPM/RPKM values: Normalized expression metrics

Quality Control Metrics

  • 📈 MultiQC Report: Comprehensive analysis summary with interactive plots

  • 📏 Fragment size distribution: Verify ribosome footprint sizes (28-30nt)

  • 🔄 3-nt periodicity: Assess codon phasing quality (hallmark of Ribo-seq)

  • 🧬 Metagene profiles: Average ribosome occupancy around start/stop codons

  • 🎯 Frame distribution: Proportion of reads in correct reading frame

Biological Discoveries

  • 🧬 uORF annotations: Upstream ORFs that regulate translation (via Ribo-TISH)

  • 🎯 Alternative start sites: Non-AUG translation initiation events

  • 📊 Translation initiation sites: Genome-wide TIS mapping

  • ⚡ Pausing sites: Locations of ribosome stalling

Visualization Files

  • 🎨 BigWig tracks: Genome browser visualization (IGV, UCSC)

  • 📈 Coverage plots: Ribosome occupancy profiles

  • 🔥 Metagene heatmaps: Average profiles across genes

🔬 Experimental Design Best Practices

  • 📊 Biological replicates: Minimum 2-3 replicates per condition

  • 🧬 RNA-seq controls: Paired RNA-seq samples for translation efficiency

  • 📏 Sequencing depth: 20-50 million reads per Ribo-seq sample

  • ✂️ Size selection: Ensure proper footprint size selection (27-31nt)

  • 🔬 rRNA depletion: Critical for high-quality Ribo-seq data

🎓 Quality Metrics to Check

  • ✅ 3-nt periodicity: Strong triplet phasing indicates high-quality data

  • ✅ Frame distribution: >70% of reads in correct reading frame

  • ✅ Fragment size: Sharp peak at 28-30 nucleotides

  • ✅ rRNA contamination: <10% ribosomal RNA reads

  • ✅ Metagene profile: Clear peaks at start/stop codons

📚 Scientific Background

Ribosome profiling was pioneered by Nicholas Ingolia, Jonathan Weissman, and colleagues (2009), revolutionizing our ability to study translation. The technique has since revealed:

  • 🧬 Pervasive translation: Many RNAs previously thought non-coding actually produce peptides

  • 📊 Translational control: mRNA abundance often poorly predicts protein levels

  • 🎯 Regulatory ORFs: Thousands of uORFs that regulate main ORF translation

  • ⚡ Codon optimality: Specific codons affect translation speed and accuracy

Perfect for Research in: Translation regulation • Drug mechanism studies • Viral infection • Cancer therapeutics • Neuroscience • Development • Circadian biology • Stress responses • Protein synthesis • Gene regulation
